news_header: Ebola continues to pose challenges, but vaccine development may alleviate its impact.
news_original_title: Ebola explained: Symptoms, treatment and vaccines
news_text: Ebola remains a significant challenge in affected regions, primarily caused by the Zaire and Sudan types of the virus. Recent outbreaks have allowed researchers to test vaccines, with notable outbreaks occurring between 2014-2016 and 2018-2020, resulting in thousands of infections and deaths. Treatments include antibody-based drugs like Ebanga and Inmazeb, and the vaccine Ervebo, which is approved in the US and EU. A new trial for a Sudan virus vaccine has also been launched in Uganda.
